org.gearvrf

Class GVRPointLight

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRJavaComponent
          • org.gearvrf.GVRLightBase
            • org.gearvrf.GVRPointLight
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRDrawFrameListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRLight, GVRSpotLight

    public class GVRPointLight
extends GVRLightBase
    Illuminates object in the scene with a point light source. The position of the light is the position of the scene object the light is attached to. Light is emitted in all directions from that point. The intensity of the light diminishes with distance from the light. Three attenuation factors are provided to specify how the intensity of the light falls off with distance: 1 / (attenuation_constant + attenuation_linear * D * attenuation_quadratic * D ** 2)

    Point light uniforms:

    derived from scene object position
    enabled1 = light is enabled, 0 = light is disabled
    world_positionposition of spot light in world coordinates/td>
    ambient_intensityintensity of ambient light emitted/td>
    diffuse_intensityintensity of diffuse light emitted/td>
    specular_intensityintensity of specular light emitted
    attenuation_constantconstant attenuation factor
    attenuation_linearlinear attenuation factor
    attenuation_quadraticquadratic attenuation factor
    Point lights currently cannot cast shadows. Enabling shadows for this light type will waste resources.
    See Also:
    GVRDirectLight, GVRSpotLight, GVRLightBase

    • Method Detail

      • getAmbientIntensity

        public float[] getAmbientIntensity()
        Get the ambient light intensity. This designates the color of the ambient reflection. It is multiplied by the material ambient color to derive the hue of the ambient reflection for that material. The built-in phong shader GVRPhongShader uses a vec4 uniform named ambient_intensity to control the intensity of ambient light reflected.
        Returns:
        The current vec4 ambient_intensity as a four-element array

      • setAmbientIntensity

        public void setAmbientIntensity(float r,
                                float g,
                                float b,
                                float a)
        Set the ambient light intensity. This designates the color of the ambient reflection. It is multiplied by the material ambient color to derive the hue of the ambient reflection for that material. The built-in phong shader GVRPhongShader uses a vec4 uniform named ambient_intensity to control the intensity of ambient light reflected.
        Parameters:
        r - red component (0 to 1)
        g - green component (0 to 1)
        b - blue component (0 to 1)
        a - alpha component (0 to 1)

      • getAttenuationConstant

        public float getAttenuationConstant()
        Get the constant attenuation factor. This dims the light by a constant amount: 1 / attenuation_constant.
        Returns:
        constant attenuation

      • getAttenuationLinear

        public float getAttenuationLinear()
        Get the constant attenuation factor. This dims the light linearly based on distance from the light: 1 / attenuation_linear * distance.
        Returns:
        linear attenuation

      • getAttenuationQuadratic

        public float getAttenuationQuadratic()
        Get the quadratic attenuation factor. This dims the light quadratically based on distance from the light: 1 / attenuation_quadratic * distance * distance.
        Returns:
        quadratic attenuation

      • setAttenuationConstant

        Set the constant attenuation factor. This dims the light by a constant amount: 1 / attenuation_constant.
        Parameters:
        v - constant attenuation value

        Set the linear attenuation factor. This dims the light linearly based on distance from the light: 1 / attenuation_linear * distance. param v linear attenuation value

      • setAttenuationQuadratic

        public void setAttenuationQuadratic(float v)
        Set the quadratic attenuation factor. This dims the light quadratically based on distance from the light: 1 / attenuation_quadratic * distance * distance.
        Parameters:
        v - quadratic attenuation value

      • setAttenuation

        Set the three attenuation constants to control how light falls off based on distance from the light source. 1 / (attenuation_constant + attenuation_linear * D * attenuation_quadratic * D ** 2)
        Parameters:

        linear - linear attenuation factor
        quadratic - quadratic attenuation factor

      • setCastShadow

        public void setCastShadow(boolean flag)
        Description copied from class: GVRLightBase
        Enable or disable shadow casting by this light. If shadow casting is enabled, GearVRF will compute shadow maps for the all of the lights which cast shadows. This is computationally intensive because it requires rendering the entire scene from the viewpoint of the light. It is memory intensive because it requires keeping a framebuffer (shadow map) for each shadow-casting light. In order for a light to actually produce shadows, it must employ a shader that performs the shadow map calculation. The built-in GVRDirectLight and GVRSpotLight can produce shadows. GVRPointLight does not currently implement shadow casting. This function will create the material and shader used for making shadow maps if necessary. It will also cause the HAS_SHADOWS symbol to be defined in the shader if shadow casting is enabled.
        Overrides:
        setCastShadow in class GVRLightBase
        Parameters:
        flag - true to enable shadow casting, false to disable
